abstract.text: A component that turns mesh surfaces into portals to a different world.

inlineContent.text: A RealityKit portal defines a way to look into a different, immersive world. You define an entity as a portal
when it also has a
that contains a mesh part with
To create a portal, set its
property to an entity with a
. Entities under that world only render within the portal.
You can enable clipping by configuring
to something
other than
For example, you can use
This ensures that the contents of the portal world donâ€™t render beyond
the portal boundary, causing depth confusion.
Entities inside the portal world with a
can freely
cross in and out of the portal boundary in any of the following platforms:
iOS 18 and later
macOS 15 and later
visionOS 2 and later
You can enable the crossing feature by configuring
to something other than
Such as

code: // Create an entity that doesn't cross beyond the portal bounds.

Different lighting environments light the portal crossing entities based on which side of the portal they
are on:
When inside the portal, the portal worldâ€™s lighting lights the entity.
When outside the portal, the default worldâ€™s lighting lights the entity.

abstract.text: Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.
A representation of a geometry or a behavior that you apply to an entity.
A component that defines a directional light source.
A component that scales the amount of light that an entity receives from its environment.
A component that contains a mesh and materials for the visual appearance of an entity.
A component that defines a point light source.
A component that turns mesh surfaces into portals to a different world.
Specifies the mode of clipping for a portal.
Disables clipping of the contents within the portal.
Clips the contents within the portal by the edge of the plane.
A representation of a portal as an infinite plane.
Specifies the mode of crossing for a portal.
Disallows contents within the portal to cross out of the portal boundary.
Allows contents within the portal to cross out of the portal along the provided plane.
Options to toggle the portal features on and off.
A representation of a portal as an infinite plane.
The clipping behavior of the portal component.
The clipping plane of the portal, using the entityâ€™s local coordinates.
The crossing behavior of the portal component.
Creates a portal component with a target entity, clipping mode, and crossing mode.
Creates a portal component with a target entity and a clipping plane.
Creates a portal component with a target entity, a single planar definition, and portal options.
The root entity for the portalâ€™s target world.
A component that allows entities to cross portal boundaries.
A material that makes the mesh part a portal to a different world.
An alias for the cull mode object thatâ€™s appropriate for this material class.
An alias for the triangle fill mode object thatâ€™s appropriate for this
material class.
A component that provides environment lighting for entities you place within the same virtual world.
A component that defines a portal world.

portal-clipping-video.alt: Four videos of space ships poking out of portals looking into outer space. Each video is in a grid formation. The two videos on the top row have clipping mode disabled so the space ships are bounded by the portal geometry. The two videos on the bottom row have clipping mode enabled so the space ships are clipped by the portal plane.

portal-crossing-video.alt: Four videos of space ships poking out of portals looking into outer space. Each video is in a grid formation. The top left video have both clipping and crossing mode disabled, so the space ship is being bounded by the portal geometry. The bottom left video have clipping mode set to plane and crossing mode disabled, so the space ship is clipped by the portal plane. The two videos on the right column have crossing mode enabled, so the spaceship is rendered outside the portal geometry.
